channel.title: Burning x360 games
channel.description:
I have TSSTcorp_CDDVDW_SH-S223C drive, will this burn dual layered discs? If not what is the cheapest/best option for me? I want a SATA drive.
Also which discs would be best for me to use? http://www.ck3.co.uk/infiniti-360-8x-white-full-face_printable-double-layer-dvd.html
Is there a tutorial on how to successfully burn backup games
edit:
also where is best to download backup games from?

item.title: Burning x360 games
item.dc:creator: @parke5 parke5
item.description:
@parke5 wrote:

Verbatim are the highest quality, but I have found even with the Verbatim discs some don’t work. Also are you aware you need Ixtreme firmware on your 360 Disc drive to play burned games.

Read full topic

item.title: Burning x360 games
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:18, topic:364199”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=460429.msg3374797#msg3374797 date=1287521039]
I use sabnzbd++ too. What kind of speeds are you getting?
[/quote]

It maxes out my connection to, which equates to about 1.1 MegaBytes per second (9.5 Megabits per second), and thats all the way over here in America, so that’s not too shabby. :)[/quote]From personal experience, the most i’ve ever gotten in speed is 37.2mb/s (megabytes). This ridiculously insane speed was hit at a friends place, he’s got a 1gbps connection shared ^^

Read full topic

item.title: Burning x360 games
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Teh Spede:

You don’t even have to have ipv6 (I just have that Teredo tunneling that comes with win7) newszilla6.xs4all.nl port 119. I just really have no idea how fast it is cause it maxes out my connection.

I use a tunnel from Hurricane Electric, that server works great with it an Sabnzbd+ though, thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Burning x360 games
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

So there is no way for me to use my DVD drive in my PC to backup games?
I found this but not sure of its validity: http://forums.afterdawn.com/thread_view.cfm/359114

item.title: Burning x360 games
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

You’d need to flash your xbox 360 dvd drive with the 0800 firmware found on xbins. Wont work on normal dvd drives

Read full topic

item.title: Burning x360 games
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:5, topic:364199”]Games: http://www.megauploadforum.net/viewtopic.php?f=81&t=25290&sid=53ebe3e6b577afd193a7861fb750ee56

You’ll need to have access to a megaupload premium account for this to been even worth bothering to do. Download megamanager to manage your megaupload downloads(http://www.megaupload.com/?c=tools).[/quote]false. Usenet is way more convenient and cheaper long-term.

item.title: Burning x360 games

item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Games: http://www.megauploadforum.net/viewtopic.php?f=81&t=25290&sid=53ebe3e6b577afd193a7861fb750ee56

You’ll need to have access to a megaupload premium account for this to been even worth bothering to do. Download megamanager to manage your megaupload downloads(http://www.megaupload.com/?c=tools).

Read full topic

item.title: Burning x360 games
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

I like to check my iso’s with abgx360 and i burn them with imgburn using the .dvd file that comes with the iso. (Dont worry about the dvd file not coming as abgx360 will create one for you. You also want to burn it as slow as possible too. So like 2.4x or 3x. Verbatims are supposed to be the best dl disks, but I myself use some cheap-ass disks that I get from my friend and have no idea what they are as they don’t have a brand. It all really depends on what burner you’ve got. http://abgx360.net/download.html for abgx360

Read full topic

item.title: Burning x360 games
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

elaborate?

edit: my writer supports dual layered discs

My Digital Life – 11 Mar 08

Samsung WriteMaster SH-S223 - The Industry's Fastest DVD Burner « My Digital...

The global leader in semiconductor, telecommunication, digital media and digital convergence technologies, Samsung has announced its new Super-WriteMaster SH-S223, which the company claims as the industry’s fastest DVD burner, offering a powerful...

I assume it is now as simple as using cloneCD and burning my .dvd to the dual layered disk? will i need to stealth the cd with anything to prevent xbl seeing anything. I wont be going on xbl but does it save a record if i were to go online later?

Read full topic
